cit:title.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-3 Geographic Information - Metadata - Part 1: Fundamentals

mri:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Important Note: This item is in mature support as of June 2023 and will retire in December 2025. A new version of this item is available for your use.Europe NUTS 0 Demographics and Boundaries provides country-level demographic, economic, and boundary information for Europe.Europe NUTS 0 Demographics and Boundaries represents areas of aggregated socioeconomic and demographic information at the NUTS 0 (country) level for Europe. NUTS (Nomenclature des Unités Territoriales Statistiques) refers to the Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics.The 2020 demographic attributes and boundaries are provided by Michael Bauer Research GmbH. These were published in 2021 and are updated annually.

mri:purpose.gco:CharacterString: Europe NUTS 0 Demographics and Boundaries presents country-level demographic and economic information for Europe.

mri:credit.gco:CharacterString: Sources: Esri; Michael Bauer Research GmbH

cit:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString:
In the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, contact Esri by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; or visit https://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

Each data vendor has its own data licensing policies and may grant varying redistribution rights to end users. Please consult the redistribution rights below for this data set provided on Data and Maps. As used herein, “Geodata” shall mean any digital data set consisting of geographic data coordinates and associated attributes.
The redistribution rights for this data set: Redistribution rights are granted by the data vendor for hard-copy renditions or static, electronic map images (e.g. .gif, .jpeg, etc.) that are plotted, printed, or publicly displayed with proper metadata and source/copyright attribution to the respective data vendor(s).
The terms and conditions below apply to all the data sets provided on Data and Maps.

The Data and Related Materials are owned by Esri and its licensor(s) and are protected by United States copyright laws and applicable international copyright treaties and/or conventions.

ESRI DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE DATA WILL MEET LICENSEE'S NEEDS OR EXPECTATIONS; THAT THE USE OF THE DATA WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED; OR THAT ALL NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS CAN OR WILL BE CORRECTED. ESRI IS NOT INVITING RELIANCE ON THIS DATA, AND THE LICENSEE SHOULD ALWAYS VERIFY ACTUAL DATA.
EXCEPT FOR THE LIMITED WARRANTY SET FORTH ABOVE, THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS CONTAINED THEREIN ARE PROVIDED "AS-IS," WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

ESRI SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIMS ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTY OF FITNESS FOR HIGH RISK ACTIVITIES.
(B) TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, LICENSEE AGREES TO INDEMNIFY, DEFEND, AND HOLD ESRI, ITS OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, SUBCONTRACTORS, LICENSORS, SUCCESSORS, AND ASSIGNS HARMLESS FROM AND AGAINST ANY AND ALL LIABILITY, LOSSES, CLAIMS, EXPENSES (INCLUDING ATTORNEYS' FEES), DEMANDS, OR DAMAGES OF ANY KIND, INCLUDING DIRECT, INDIRECT, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, INCIDENTAL, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, ARISING OUT OF OR IN ANY WAY CONNECTED WITH LICENSEE'S USE OR PERMITTING THE USE BY OTHERS OF THE DATA, AND VENDOR'S HARDWARE OR SOFTWARE FOR HIGH RISK ACTIVITIES. IN NO EVENT SHALL ESRI AND/OR ITS LICENSOR(S) BE LIABLE FOR COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOST PROFITS, LOST SALES, OR BUSINESS EXPENDITURES, INVESTMENTS, OR COMMITMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH ANY BUSINESS; LOSS OF ANY GOODWILL; OR FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR USE OF THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS, HOWEVER CAUSED, ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, AND WHETHER OR NOT ESRI OR ITS LICENSOR(S) HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. Third Party Beneficiary: Esri's licensor(s) has (have) authorized Esri to (sub)distribute and (sub)license its (their) data as incorporated into the Data and Related Materials. mrd:orderingInstructions.gco:CharacterString: Data and Maps is available only as part of ArcGIS® software.

mdq:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired.
After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

cit:title.gco:CharacterString: MBR - Economic and Sociodemographic Data for Europe; MBR - Digital Boundaries Maps for Europe. Levels: NUTS 3, NUTS 2, NUTS 1, and NUTS 0

mrl:description.gco:CharacterString:
Michael Bauer Research GmbH established the data by reviewing relevant regional data and projecting the respective trends. For providing the most possible value to the user regarding comparability, all country results were projected by mathematical methods to the required geographical level, homogeneous base years, categories (e.g., age bands) and currency (Euro).
Other remarks: - For Azerbaijan the number of households, average number of persons per household, dwellings and purchasing power growth rate are not surveyed. - For Vatican City only total population and population density are surveyed. - For Andorra, Liechtenstein, Georgia and San Marino the number of dwellings and purchasing power growth rate are not surveyed. - For Gibraltar the number of dwellings, purchasing power growth rate and gross domestic product are not surveyed. - For Monaco the purchasing power growth rate is not surveyed. - For Jersey, Guernsey and Isle of Man only total population, population density and population growth are surveyed. - For Ukraine, because of significant regional distortions in the wake of the political situation in the Crimea and the East of the country since 2014, a reliable evaluation of regional market data is currently not possible for the Autonomous Republic of Crimea, Sevastopol and the Oblasts Donets'ka and Luhans'ka. Therefore, regional market data for Ukraine is given without these areas.
Michael Bauer Research GmbH provided Esri with: MBR - Economic and Sociodemographic Data for Europe (tables) and MBR - Digital Boundaries Maps for Europe, levels: NUTS 3, NUTS 2, NUTS 1, and NUTS 0 (shapefiles).

The following steps were performed by Esri: Started with the data in the custom package from Michael Bauer Research GmbH. The data included four NUTS shapefiles and an Excel file that contained data for each of the four NUTS shapefiles. Joined each Excel tab to its corresponding NUTS shapefile. Converted each dataset into a file geodatabase. For datasets NUTS 1, NUTS 2, and NUTS 3, added and coded the NUTS0 field. Renamed and reordered some fields in each of the four datasets. Added the SQKM field to each of the four datasets and calculated its values projected to Europe Equidistant Conic. Ran Topology Simplify tool to slightly generalize linework and greatly reduce each dataset’s size.
